sub_title: Executive Secretary at Meijers Committee - European Law Researcher - Academic
summary:
Ambitious, analytically-minded and well-organised professional with demonstrated research and work experience in the legal and social domain, able to connect people from different cultures and backgrounds. I approach challenges with a pro-active mindset and possess a can-do personality. 

Core skills: Academic Writing, Empirical and Legal Research, Cross-cultural Communication, Stakeholder Engagement, Project Coordination, Teamwork, Social Media, Linking Science, Policy and Practice

treasury_media.title: Reactie van de Commissie Meijers op de Kamerbrief inzake besluitvorming omtrent de opvangcrisis
treasury_media.description: Op vrijdag 26 augustus 2022 heeft de Staatssecretaris van Justitie en Veiligheid in een brief aan de voorzitter van de Tweede Kamer een reeks van maatregelen aangekondigd om het aantal vluchtelingen in Ter Apel terug te brengen en de uitstroom te bevorderen. In deze notitie geeft de Commissie Meijers uitvoerig commentaar op de recente kamerbrief 'besluitvorming omtrent de opvangcrisis' en de aangekondigde maatregelen die in strijd zijn met EU-recht.

projects.title: ETHOS - Towards the European THeory Of juStice and fairness
projects.description: As a researcher affiliated at the Utrecht University, I am currently working on the ETHOS project. The ETHOS project seeks to provide building blocks for the development of an empirically informed European theory of justice by: refining and deepening knowledge of historical and contemporary European foundations of justice; enhancing awareness of mechanisms that impede the realisation of justice in contemporary Europe; advancing our understanding of the process of drawing and re-drawing of the boundaries of justice (fault lines); and providing guidance to politicians, policy makers, advocates and other stakeholders on how to design and implement policies to reverse inequalities and prevent injustice.

profile_positions.description:
The Meijers Committee is a standing body of experts on European migration, refugee, and criminal law and composed of law professors, researchers, judges, and attorneys. It advises politicians, policy makers, and the broader public on the impact of European legislative proposals in the field of justice, migration, and security on human rights and the rule of law. 

As the executive secretary I am in charge of, amongst others, the following tasks:
• Advising on the (strategic) impact and activities of the Committee towards national and EU institutions
• Identifying relevant national and international developments in legislation, case law and literature
• Conducting legal research and drafting legal advice
• Representing the Meijers Committee at seminars and hearings
• Managing the Committee's finances and coordinating the project 'Watching over the rule of law in Europe'
• Preparation of budgets and annual reports
profile_positions.title: Executive Secretary and Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Academie van de Stad (AvdS) is an innovative, social entrepreneur that stands for cities with active, committed citizens. Through effective connections with local stakeholders and education, AvdS gives students a key role in the positive development of the city. As a project coordinator, my main tasks are as follows:
- Project management
- Project acquisition
- Network activities
- Supervision and coaching of students

Examples of projects that I have managed:
- StudentJobcoach Refugees: https://academievandestad.nl/projecten/studentjobcoach-refugees-almere/
- Interactieve Uiting Grondwet: https://academievandestad.nl/projecten/interactieve-uiting-grondwet/
- Springlevend Wonen de Hoven: https://academievandestad.nl/projecten/springlevende-wijk-de-hoven/

See for more information about the projects that we conduct: https://academievandestad.nl
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Researcher for the EU funded Horizon 20-20 ETHOS project: ETHOS investigates the normative underpinnings and practical realisation in Europe of four domains of justice: social, economic, political, and civil and symbolic. In doing so, the project will explore: (a) philosophical and political tradition, (b) legal frameworks, (c) daily (bureaucratic) practices, (d) current public debates, and (e) accounts of vulnerable populations in six European countries (the Netherlands, the UK, Hungary, Austria, Portugal and Turkey).
See for more information on this multidisciplinary project: https://www.ethos-europe.eu
- Work Package Coordination: completed deliverables on social policy, migration and justice in Europe 
- Junior lecturer in European Law, supervision of theses at bachelor level
- Project coordination of projects on EU (citizenship) law
profile_positions.title: Academic Researcher and Junior Lecturer European law

The Erasmus Studio is carrying out a research program that includes a number of projects with researchers from various disciplinary backgrounds, such as social sciences, economics, management research, humanities and computer science. Strong collaborative links with the University Library are being maintained and the Erasmus Studio also organizes seminars in which senior researchers as well as PhD students and undergraduates can participate.
profile_positions.title: Academic Research Assistant at Erasmus Studio for E-research

profile_positions.description:
Assisted in the project coordination of the Balkan Voices project as part of my research practicum embedded in the Honours Programme. Tasks included translation and transcription, network coordination, assisting in project research and working on a bibliography and literature research of oral history documents from the former Yugoslavia.

PostYugoslav Voices (aka Balkan Voices)  is the name of a series of initiatives of the Erasmus Studiofor e-research of the Erasmus University Rotterdam, aimed at applying innovative search technology in digital recorded oral history carried out in several regions in former Yugoslavia. See for more information on the project: http://balkanvoices.org
profile_positions.title: Research Intern Project Balkan Voices (alias Post-Yugoslav Voices)

profile_positions.description:
As part of my LRM, I worked as a legal researcher for the bEU-citizen project, which aims to understand the barriers that Europen Union citizens face in understanding and enjoying the rights they have.
In particular, I conducted research and wrote a report on the life-events (e.g. marriage, parentage, adoption rights) that EU citizens enjoy in the Netherlands within a cross-border perspective.
See for the report: http://beucitizen.eu/wp-content/uploads/D7.5-FINAL-8.12.2016.pdf

In addition, in 2015 I presented my paper on  the free movement of same-sex couples during the annual bEUcitizen conference in Zagreb.
See for full published paper: http://beucitizen.eu/wp-content/uploads/Conference-Paper-bEUcitizen-June-2015_Barbara-Safradin.pdf
profile_positions.title: Legal Researcher bEUcitizen project

profile_positions.description:
The European Law Moot Court Competition is an annual moot court competition which is held between rival teams consisting of university students who have an interest in European Union law. The first official competition was held in 1989. It is considered the most prestigious moot court competition within the field of EU Law and one of the most prestigious moot court competitions in the world.

* The case at hand concerned the free movement of same-sex couples within the EU, which inspired me to write a LLM Thesis on this topic. Our team went to the regional semi-finals in Bratislava.
profile_positions.title: Representative Utrecht University at European Law Moot Court Competition

profile_positions.description:
In 2013, a group of 75 excellent students, each outstanding and unique in their own way, were selected by Mckinsey & Company for the 2013 edition to experience the dynamics of Asia and work on the overarching research question: how can we enhance Dutch business with China? The participants came from a variety of disciplines, giving the NAHSS a unique multidisciplinary character. The summer program has not only expanded in the number of participants, but also geographically: 40 students attended the International Summer School at the Chinese University of Hong Kong, 15 students attended the summer school at the National Chenghi University of Taiwan, and 15 students followed courses at the National Taiwan University. In addition to the summer school courses, the students worked on four distinct projects. The students reunited in Shanghai to attend a business week where they conducted business visits at Dutch companies and entrepreneurs.

An important element in this Summer school was participating in a project called Chinese Top Ten. In this project, the candidates worked as a consultant for several Dutch multinationals to help solve the issue of gaining and retaining Chinese Top Talent. This way the companies get valuable research and students get a unique insight in the day-to-day operations of Dutch companies in Asia.
profile_positions.title: Candidate Netherlands Asia Honours Summer School

volunteer_experiences.description: Contributing to collect money for the victims of the natural disaster in Bosnia and Herzegovina in May and June 2014 - Social Media Campaign

Livings books are a concept of the Human Library, which has its origins from Denmark. It brings people together, in order to investigate and challenge prejudices. Just like a real library, where books provide an insight to unknown worlds, the Human Library offers its visitors the chance to step into the world of another person. In a very simple way: by providing a space for a nice conversation.

See for more information: https://www.thehumanlibrary.nl
